definition: nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]
to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: The traditional needle book machine which has over a hundred years of history.
sentences.chinese: 傳統的釘書機產品到今天已有一百多年的歷史。

sentences.english: He wants a stapler, but she have not get one.
sentences.chinese: 他想要一個釘書機，但她沒有。

sentences.english: Use a staple gun to attach the batting and fabric in place.
sentences.chinese: 用一個釘書機把綿絮和布料固定在一定的位置上。

sentences.english: Rufus: luckily, staple guns are old school.
sentences.chinese: 還好，釘書機是舊式古董啊。

sentences.english: We will also increase stock of office supplies such as paper, pens, and staplers.
sentences.chinese: 我們也將增加辦公用品比如紙筆和釘書機的存貨。

sentences.english: NO01, I wonder if they have any staplers in the stationery department.
sentences.chinese: 不知道他們的文具部有沒有釘書機。

sentences.english: It's not like I really care. I mean, it's just a stapler .
sentences.chinese: 我的意思是，那隻不過是一個釘書機罷了。

sentences.english: For example, fill up the copier or printer with paper after you’re done using it.
sentences.chinese: 不如說在使用完複印機或者釘書機後裝滿紙盒釘。

sentences.english: May I borrow your stapler? Mine's broken.
sentences.chinese: 可以借用一下你的釘書機嗎？我的壞了。

sentences.english: Nancy:You just slipped that stapler into your pocket.
sentences.chinese: 你剛纔把釘書機偷偷放到你的口袋裏。

sentences.english: Seal with glue. Do not use staples.
sentences.chinese: 請用膠水封口，切勿用釘書機封口。

definition: lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight/also written 觸目驚心|触目惊心
to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
